intro: Chaenorhinum minus f. brevipedunculatum, commonly known as the short-stemmed common flax. It is a compact, annual herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The species belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. Its short peduncles and dense flowering habit make it a distinctive feature in its native habitat.
